com.hp.mss.hpprint.model

Class ImagePrintItem

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.hp.mss.hpprint.model.PrintItem
      • com.hp.mss.hpprint.model.ImagePrintItem

  • public class ImagePrintItem
extends PrintItem
    Once you create an image asset, you need to associate it with a PrintItem object. You will need to provide a ScaleType and the ImageAsset itself.

    • Constructor Detail

      • ImagePrintItem

        public ImagePrintItem(PrintAttributes.MediaSize mediaSize,
                      PrintItem.ScaleType scaleType,
                      ImageAsset asset)
        Create an ImagePrintItem with defined media size, scale type, and asset.
        Parameters:
        mediaSize - The media size you want the asset to be used for.
        scaleType - The scale type used to layout the asset on the media.
        asset - The asset itself.

      • ImagePrintItem

        public ImagePrintItem(PrintAttributes.MediaSize mediaSize,
                      ImageAsset asset)
        Create an ImagePrintItem without a defined scale type. Fit to page will be used.
        Parameters:
        mediaSize - The media size you want the asset to be used for.
        asset - The asset itself.

      • ImagePrintItem

        public ImagePrintItem(ImageAsset asset)
        Create an ImagePrintItem with only the asset. This will use the default scale type and a null media size.
        Parameters:
        asset - The asset itself.

                     float dpi,
                     RectF pageBounds)
        Description copied from class: PrintItem
        Draw the printItem onto a canvas.
        Specified by:
        drawPage in class PrintItem
        Parameters:
        canvas - The canvas to be drawn on
        dpi - The dpi of the canvas
        pageBounds - The bounds of the page on the canvas. (Canvas can be bigger than the page we want to draw on.
